item.title: about
item.description:
What are the limits of perception?

I am a Lecturer in the Faculty of Philosophy at the University of Cambridge.

I am a Bye-Fellow of Queens’ College.

My research focuses on perception and the mind. In particular, I concentrate on the role of perceptual media—such as sounds, images, and optical technology. So far my articles have covered the experience of sounds, images, and mirror perception. I also like to dabble into controversies about philosophical method.

I teach Philosophical Logic, Theory of Meaning, Metaphysics of Persons, and a number of lecture series in the Philosophy of Mind and Cognitive Science.

Besides writing about and teaching philosophy I am a coffee nerd and web developer.
